member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.name
member.summary: The name of the bucket being listed. Null if the request fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.prefix
member.summary: The prefix echoed back from the request. Null if the request fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.marker
member.summary: The marker echoed back from the request. Null if the request fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.delimiter
member.summary: The delimiter echoed back from the request. Null if not specified in the request or it fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.maxKeys
member.summary: The maxKeys echoed back from the request if specified. 0 if the request fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.isTruncated
member.summary: Indicates if there are more results to the list. True if the current list results have been truncated. The value will be false if the request fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.nextMarker
member.summary: Indicates what to use as a marker for subsequent list requests in the event that the results are truncated. Present only when a delimiter is specified. Null if the requests fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.entries
member.summary: A list of ListEntry objects representing the objects in the given bucket. Null if the request fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.ListBucketResponse.commonPrefixEntries
member.summary: A list of CommonPrefixEntry objects representing the common prefixes of the keys that matched up to the delimiter. Null if the request fails.

member.name: F:Xameleon.Utility.S3.CommonPrefixEntry.prefix
member.summary: The prefix common to the delimited keys it represents.

member.name: T:Mono.WebServer.IRequestBroker
member.summary: This interface is used for classes that manage requests.

member.summary: Calculates the endpoint based on the calling format.

members.member: This class mimics the behavior of AWSAuthConnection, except instead of actually performing the operation, QueryStringAuthGenerator will return URLs with query string parameters that can be used to do the same thing. These parameters include an expiration date, so that if you hand them off to someone else, they will only work for a limited amount of time.

member.name: P:Xameleon.Utility.S3.QueryStringAuthGenerator.Expires
member.summary: Sets/Gets the milliseconds since the Epoch that this expires at

member.name: T:Xameleon.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Xameleon.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Xameleon.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Xameleon.Properties.Resources.SourceXml
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to http://xslt.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Modules/DataFilter/init.xml.

member.name: P:Xameleon.Properties.Resources.SourceXslt
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to http://xslt.googlecode.com/svn/test/extensionfunction.xsl.

member.name: T:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker
member.summary: This class provides a request broker covering the base functionality.
member.remarks: A request broker serves as an intermediary between and to handle the interaction between app-domains.

member.summary: Contains the initial request capacity of a .

member.name: F:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.reqlock
member.summary: Contains a lock to use when accessing and modifying the request allocation tables.

member.name: F:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.request_ids
member.summary: Contains the request ID's.

member.name: F:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.requests
member.summary: Contains the registered workers.

member.name: F:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.buffers
member.summary: Contains buffers for the requests to use.

member.name: F:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.requests_count
member.summary: Contains the number of active requests.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.GrowRequests(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Grows the size of the request allocation tables by 33%.
member.param: A containing the current length of the allocation tables.
A containing the ID to use for a new request.

note.para: This *MUST* be called with the reqlock held!

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.GetNextRequestId
member.summary: Gets the next available request ID, expanding the array of possible ID's if necessary.
member.returns: A containing the ID of the request.

note.para: This *MUST* be called with the reqlock held!

member.summary: Registers a request with the current instance.
member.param: A object containing the request to register.
member.returns: A containing the ID of the request.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.UnregisterRequest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Unregisters a request with the current instance.
member.param: A containing the ID of the request.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.ValidRequest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets whether or not the request with a specified ID is valid.
member.param: A containing the ID of the request.
member.returns: A indicating whether or not the request is valid.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.Read(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Reads a block of request data from the request with a specified ID.
member.param: A containing the ID of the request.
A containing the number of bytes to read.
A containing the read data.
member.returns: A containing the number of bytes that were actually read.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.GetWorker(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the request with a specified ID.
member.param: A containing the ID of the request.
member.returns: A object containing the request with the specified ID, or if the request does not exist.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.Write(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a block of response data to the request with a specified ID.
member.param: A containing the ID of the request.
A containing data to write.
A containing the position in it which to start writing from.
A containing the number of bytes to write.

remarks.para: If the request does not exist, no action is taken.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.Close(System.Int32)
member.summary: Closes the request with a specified ID.
member.param: A containing the ID of the request.

remarks.para: If the request does not exist, no action is taken.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.BaseRequestBroker.Flush(System.Int32)
member.summary: Flushes the request with a specified ID.
member.param: A containing the ID of the request.

remarks.para: If the request does not exist, no action is taken.

member.returns: A indicating whether or not the request is connected. If the request doesn't exist, will be returned.
member.remarks: See .

member.summary: Obtains a lifetime service object for the current instance.

This type is used internally to create a in a specified via .

member.summary: Creates a request broker for managing requests.
member.returns: A containing a request broker for managing requests.

member.summary: Disposes of the the resources contained in the current instance.

member.summary: Disposes of the the resources contained in the current instance.

member.name: T:Mono.WebServer.Worker
member.summary: This abstract is used for running implementation specific requests.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.Worker.SetReuseCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of times the current instance has been reused by the server.
member.param: A containing the number of times the current instance has been reused.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.Worker.GetRemainingReuses
member.summary: Gets the number of times the current instance can be reused by the server.
member.returns: A containing the number of times the current instance can be reused by the server.
member.remarks: If less than or equal to zero, the current instance should not be reused and the resources associated with it should be freed.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.Worker.Run(System.Object)
member.summary: Runs the current instance.
member.param: A containing state information from the worker that evoked the method. Always .
member.remarks: If the entire process of running the request is done in the method, should be set to . If, however, the method evokes an asynchronous or threaded call, like , should be set to .

member.summary: Reads a block of request data from the current implementation.
member.param: A to be populated with the read data.
A containing the position in it which to start storing the read data.
A containing the number of bytes to read.
member.returns: A containing the number of bytes that were actually read.

member.summary: Writes a block of response data from the current implementation.
member.param: A containing data to write.
A containing the position in it which to start writing from.
A containing the number of bytes to write.

member.summary: Closes the current instance and releases the resources associated with the data transfer.

member.summary: Causes all response data to be written.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.Worker.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets whether or not the current instance is connected.
member.returns: A indicating whether or not the current instance is connected.

member.name: P:Mono.WebServer.Worker.IsAsync
member.summary: Gets whether or not the current instance is asynchronous.
member.value: A indicating whether or not the current instance is asynchronous.
member.remarks: This property indicates whether or not a call to will spawn its own worker thread. indicates that the entire process will be completed in a single thread during the duration of .

member.summary: Gets the preloaded entity data for the current instance.
member.returns: A containing the preloaded entity data contained from the request.

member.summary: Evokes the registered delegates one by one until the path is mapped.

member.returns: A containing the mapped physical path of the request, or if the path was not successfully mapped.

member.name: M:Mono.WebServer.MonoWorkerRequest.MapPath(System.String)
member.summary: Maps the virtual path of the request to a physical path.
member.param: A containing the virutal path of the request.
member.returns: A containing the mapped physical path of the request.
member.remarks: By default, the path will be mapped using the virtual and physical paths of the used to create the current instance. To override this, register a with .

members.member: An interface into the S3 system. It is initially configured with authentication and connection parameters and exposes methods to access and manipulate S3 data.

member.name: M:Xameleon.Utility.S3.AWSAuthConnection.createBucket(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new bucket.
member.param: The name of the bucket to create
A Map of string to string representing the headers to pass (can be null)

member.name: M:Xameleon.Utility.S3.AWSAuthConnection.listBucket(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Collections.SortedList)
member.summary: Lists the contents of a bucket.
member.param: The name of the bucket to list
All returned keys will start with this string (can be null)
All returned keys will be lexographically greater than this string (can be null)
The maximum number of keys to return (can be 0)
A Map of string to string representing HTTP headers to pass.

member.name: M:Xameleon.Utility.S3.AWSAuthConnection.listBucket(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Collections.SortedList)
member.summary: Lists the contents of a bucket.
member.param: The name of the bucket to list
All returned keys will start with this string (can be null)
All returned keys will be lexographically greater than this string (can be null)
The maximum number of keys to return (can be 0)
A Map of string to string representing HTTP headers to pass.
Keys that contain a string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter will be rolled up into a single element.
